summary: This document is an email chain from March 2020 discussing updates in the probate proceedings of Jeffrey Epstein's estate. It covers the Virgin Islands Attorney General's legal actions against the estate, disputes over the victim compensation fund, and the filing of a verified inventory valuing the estate at approximately $635 million.

persons.name: Talia Kraemer
persons.context: Recipient of an email update regarding the Epstein probate case.

persons.name: Denise George
persons.context: Brought charges against Epstein's estate, alleged his lawyers were part of his fraud, and is opposing the current victim compensation fund proposal.

persons.name: Darren Indyke
persons.context: Named as an executor in Epstein's will and alleged by the Virgin Islands AG to have been part of Epstein's alleged fraud.

persons.name: Richard Kahn
persons.context: Named as an executor in Epstein's will and alleged by the Virgin Islands AG to have been part of Epstein's alleged fraud.

persons.name: Bennet Moskowitz
persons.context: Claimed that liens against the estate have prevented the release of money for a victim compensation fund.

persons.name: Ken Feinberg
persons.context: Reportedly asked to oversee a voluntary resolution program for Epstein's accusers.

persons.name: Edward Helmore
persons.context: Author of a Guardian article about the dispute between Epstein's lawyers and the Virgin Islands.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the probate proceedings; his estate is valued at roughly $635 million and is the focus of legal disputes and victim claims.

connections.description: Both named as executors of Jeffrey Epstein's will.
Indyke was Epstein's lawyer and was named as an executor of his will.
Kahn was Epstein's lawyer and was named as an executor of his will.
Moskowitz is representing Epstein's estate in probate proceedings.
The Virgin Islands AG alleged Indyke may have been part of Epstein's alleged fraud and plans to name him as a co-defendant.
The Virgin Islands AG alleged Kahn may have been part of Epstein's alleged fraud and plans to name him as a co-defendant.
Epstein's estate reportedly asked for Feinberg to oversee a victim compensation program.

events.title: Filing of Verified Inventory
events.description: The executors of Epstein's estate filed their first verified inventory of estate property, valuing total assets at roughly $635 million.

events.title: Probate Court Denies AG's Motion
events.description: The probate court denied the Virgin Islands Attorney General's motion to intervene in the Epstein probate proceedings.

events.title: AG's Demands for Compensation Program
events.description: The Virgin Islands AG sent a letter to the estate executors laying out demands for a fair victim compensation program, including cooperation with investigations and waiving NDAs.

events.title: Guardian Article on Estate Dispute
events.description: The Guardian published an article detailing the dispute between Epstein's estate lawyers and the Virgin Islands Attorney General over the victim compensation fund and fraud allegations.

events.title: Virgin Islands AG Brings Charges
events.description: Virgin Islands Attorney General Denise George brought charges against Epstein's estate and alleged his lawyers were part of his alleged fraud.

events.title: Epstein's Death
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein died by suicide in a Manhattan jail cell.

events.title: Epstein's Arrest on New Charges
events.description: Epstein was arrested on fresh federal sex trafficking and conspiracy charges.

events.title: Epstein's Florida Guilty Plea
events.description: Epstein pleaded guilty to a Florida state prostitution charge and served a 13-month jail sentence.

locations: Epstein's two islands (in the Virgin Islands)
keyFacts: The total value of Jeffrey Epstein's estate assets is approximately $635 million, as per a verified inventory filed in March 2020.

The Virgin Islands Attorney General, Denise George, has brought charges against the estate and alleged that Epstein's lawyers/executors, Darren Indyke and Richard Kahn, may have been part of Epstein's alleged fraud.

A major dispute exists over the victim compensation fund, with the AG opposing the estate's proposed fund for lacking fairness and accountability, and demanding the estate waive NDAs for former employees.
The estate's bank accounts were frozen due to the Virgin Islands AG's liens, preventing the executors from accessing funds for administrative expenses or the victim fund without prior AG approval.
Epstein modified his will two days before his death to have it executed in the US Virgin Islands, naming Darren Indyke and Richard Kahn as executors.
